summary: G. Robert Blakey was the Chief Counsel and Staff Director for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports from the HSCA between 1977 and 1979. These documents list Blakey as an employee of the committee, indicating his active role during the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents detail his presence on the payroll, confirming his leadership position within the committee during its operational period.
significance: As Chief Counsel and Staff Director for the HSCA, G. Robert Blakey played a central role in the investigation into the assassination of JFK. His leadership was crucial in guiding the committee's research, hearings, and final report, which had a significant impact on the understanding and interpretation of the events surrounding the assassination.
